messages.subject: mandatory testing in MN
messages.msgSnippet: Yes, for all parents.  However, we do not have to report the scores.....yet. You have to tell them what test you will use and where it will be administered.
messages.messageBody:
Yes, for all parents. However, we do not have to report the scores.....yet.
You have to tell them what test you will use and where it will be
administered.
Chris


"Shyrley" <shyrley.williams@...> wrote:
<br>
<html><body>


<tt>
On 1 Nov 02, at 10:58, Chris wrote:<BR>
<BR>
> Minnesota requires it annually.<BR>
> I'm really enjoying this discussion and the great viewpoints!<BR>
> Chris<BR>
> <BR>
Even for parents with degrees? I thought I read that they were <BR>
exempt?<BR>
Not that it makes any difference. Its not like when we move to <BR>
Minnesota next year I will be calling the school board.....;-)<BR>
<BR>
Shyrley<BR>
<BR>
<BR>
"You laugh at me because I'm different. I laugh at you because you are all the
same."<BR>
<BR>
</tt>
